page.title: 20HOUSING STAUNTON
page.content: A GROUP OF CHILDREN FROM WYESHAM JUNIOR SCHOOL SURVEYED STAUNTON VILLAGE ON 26TH JUNE 1985. We left the Church and walked down the old village street where we saw The Elms, a private home for elderly people. We passed a house called Victoria Cottage which was built in 1719, also a house called{The Steps which was built in the 17th Century.Opposite was{new development. Soon we reached the{Post Office}which included an off licence, village shop and cafe. The shop, off licence and cafe opened from 8.30 to 21.00 hours. The White Horse Inn is the last pub in England. Opposite in the local Garage {petrol prices}were Â£2.04 for 4-star and Â£2.02 for 2-star. The minimum charge in the public telephone kiosk is 10 pence.
